info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-bgp-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for bgp operational data.
     Copyright (c) 2016-2020, 2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Routing Protocols
**Paths:** 1

**YANG Model:** [Cisco-IOS-XE-bgp-oper.yang](https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/main/vendor/cisco/xe/17181/Cisco-IOS-XE-bgp-oper.yang)

current-prefixes.description: The current number of accepted prefixes

total-prefixes.description: The total number of accepted prefixes

implicit-withdraw.description:
The number of times a prefix has been
         withdrawn and readvertised

explicit-withdraw.description:
The number of times a prefix has been
         withdrawn because it is no longer feasible

bestpaths.description: The number of received prefixes installed as best paths

multipaths.description: The number of received prefixes installed as multipaths

current-prefixes.description: The current number of accepted prefixes

total-prefixes.description: The total number of accepted prefixes

implicit-withdraw.description:
The number of times a prefix has been
         withdrawn and readvertised

explicit-withdraw.description:
The number of times a prefix has been
         withdrawn because it is no longer feasible

bestpaths.description: The number of received prefixes installed as best paths

multipaths.description: The number of received prefixes installed as multipaths

total-established.description:
The number of times a TCP and BGP
         connection has been successfully established

total-dropped.description:
The number of times that a valid
         session has failed or been taken down

last-reset.description: Time since peering session was last reset

reset-reason.description: The reason for the last reset

path-mtu-discovery.description: Indication whether path MTU discovery is enabled

local-port.description: Local TCP port used for TCP session

local-host.description: Local address used for the TCP session

foreign-port.description: Remote port used by the peer for the TCP session

foreign-host.description: Remote address of the BGP session

ao-keychain-name.description: Name of the Key Chain for AO

ao-key-id.description: ID of the key for AO

default-originate.description: Originate default route to this neighbor

default-map.description: Set a command to its defaults

weight.description: Set default weight for routes from this neighbor

maximum-prefix.description: Maximum number of prefixes accepted from this peer

as-override.description: Override matching AS number while sending update

as-override-split-horizon.description: Split horizon processing before sending updates

allow-as.description: Accept as-path with my AS present in it

allow-policy.description: Enable the policy support for this IBGP Neighbor

rr-client.description: Configure a neighbor as Route Reflector client

aigp.description: aigp attribute sent to this neighbor

aigp-med.description: aigp as med attribute sent to this neighbor

aigp-cost.description: aigp as cost-community attribute sent to this neighbor

nexthop-unchanged.description: Propagate the iBGP path's next hop unchanged for this neighbor

nexthop-unchanged-all.description: Propagate next hop unchanged for all paths to this neighbor

nexthop-self.description: Disable the next hop calculation for this neighbor

nexthop-self-all.description: Disable the next hop EBGP calculation for this neighbor

send-community.description: Send community attribute to this neighbor

valid-redirect-off.description: Disable validations on Redirect-IP ext comm

remove-private-as.description: Remove private AS number for outbound updates

encap.description: Preferred encapsulation name for the neighbor

llgr-stale-time-send.description: Send long live graceful restart stale time

llgr-stale-time-accept.description: Receive long live graceful restart stale time

configured-policies.description: Configured policies in a peer policy

inherited-policies.description: Inherited policies in a peer policy

bgp-version.description:
BGP version being used to communicate
         with the remote router

up-time.description:
Amount of time the bgp session has been
         up since being established

last-write.description: Time since BGP last sent a message to the neighbor

last-read.description: Time since BGP last received a message from the neighbor

negotiated-keepalive-timers.description: Negotiated keepalive timers status of BGP neighbor

total-established.description:
The number of times a TCP and BGP
         connection has been successfully established

total-dropped.description:
The number of times that a valid
         session has failed or been taken down

last-reset.description: Time since peering session was last reset

reset-reason.description: The reason for the last reset

path-mtu-discovery.description: Indication whether path MTU discovery is enabled

local-port.description: Local TCP port used for TCP session

local-host.description: Local address used for the TCP session

foreign-port.description: Remote port used by the peer for the TCP session

foreign-host.description: Remote address of the BGP session

ao-keychain-name.description: Name of the Key Chain for AO

ao-key-id.description: ID of the key for AO

current-prefixes.description: The current number of accepted prefixes

total-prefixes.description: The total number of accepted prefixes

implicit-withdraw.description:
The number of times a prefix has been
         withdrawn and readvertised

explicit-withdraw.description:
The number of times a prefix has been
         withdrawn because it is no longer feasible

bestpaths.description: The number of received prefixes installed as best paths

multipaths.description: The number of received prefixes installed as multipaths
